meanings.definition: Unable to be expressed in words.
meanings.sent1: The painting's beauty had an inexpressibility that left viewers speechless.
meanings.sent2: Her joy at the surprise party was so great that it had an inexpressibility about it.
meanings.sent3: The inexpressibility of the magic trick made everyone wonder how it was done.
meanings.sent4: The inexpressibility of the mountain's grandeur took my breath away.
meanings.sent5: The inexpressibility of his emotions made it hard for others to understand him.

meanings.definition: The state of being beyond description.
meanings.sent1: The inexpressibility of the sunset was truly breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The inexpressibility of her love for him was evident in every gesture.
meanings.sent3: The inexpressibility of the situation made it hard to explain to others.
meanings.sent4: The inexpressibility of the music transported me to another world.
meanings.sent5: The inexpressibility of the moment lingered in the air long after it had passed.
